title: Sum of Two Numbers
description: Learn to add two numbers together and return the result.
detailed_description: Write a function that takes two numbers and adds them together. return the sum. this is your first python function - it should have two parameters (a and b). use the + operator to add the numbers. don't forget to return the result using the return keyword.
solution:
def sum_two_numbers(a, b):
    return a + b

title: Reverse a String
description: Reverse the order of characters in a string.
detailed_description: take a string and return it backwards. use string slicing [::-1] or a loop. string slicing is the easiest way - just add [::-1] after your string variable. the -1 means go backwards through each character. you can also use a for loop to build the reversed string character by character.

title: Find Maximum
description: Find and return the largest number from a list.
detailed_description: find the biggest number in a list. you can use max() function or loop through the list. the max() function is built into python and does this automatically. if you want to do it manually, start with the first number and compare it to each other number in the list. keep track of the largest one you've seen so far.

title: Count Vowels
description: Count how many vowels appear in a given string.
detailed_description: count how many vowels (a, e, i, o, u) are in a string. ignore uppercase/lowercase. loop through each character in the string and check if it's a vowel. use .lower() to make everything lowercase first so you don't miss uppercase vowels. keep a counter and add 1 each time you find a vowel.
solution:
def count_vowels(s):
    return sum(1 for c in s.lower() if c in 'aeiou')

title: FizzBuzz
description: Return 'Fizz', 'Buzz', 'FizzBuzz', or the number based on divisibility.
detailed_description: if number divides by 15 return 'fizzbuzz', by 3 return 'fizz', by 5 return 'buzz', else return the number as string. use the % operator to check if a number divides evenly (remainder is 0). check 15 first because it's both 3 and 5. remember to convert the number to a string using str() when returning it.

title: Palindrome Check
description: Check if a string reads the same forwards and backwards.
detailed_description: check if a string reads the same forwards and backwards. ignore spaces and case. first clean the string by making it lowercase and removing spaces. then compare it to its reverse using [::-1]. if they're the same, it's a palindrome. return true or false.

input: A man a plan a canal Panama

title: Two Sum
description: Find two numbers in a list that sum to a target value.
detailed_description: find two numbers in a list that add up to target. return their positions (indices). you need to find which two numbers add up to the target value. return their index positions (0, 1, 2, etc) not the actual numbers. you can use nested loops or a dictionary to track what numbers you've seen and their positions.

title: String to Integer (atoi)
description: Convert a string to a 32-bit signed integer (atoi).
detailed_description: convert string to integer like int() function. skip spaces, handle +/- signs, read digits until non-digit. return 0 if no digits found. start by skipping any spaces at the beginning. check for + or - signs to know if it's positive or negative. then read each digit character and build up the number. stop when you hit a non-digit character.
